reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My sons love this series and we're excited to find a graphic novel version. They said it was well find, better (and thicker) than they expected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Arrived super fast in brand new condition. My girls love this series and have been begging me for the graphic novel! They were not disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is the best. What I hopped for exactly!
reviews.reviewText: This is my favorite novel series and adding in a graphic novel was awesome. I just really wish that the book covered a bit more of the story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice introduction to KOTLC
reviews.reviewText: Like many readers, I am anxiously awaiting the release of the latest KOTLC book. As an avid fan, I purchased the graphic novel to help lessen the wait.I did not realize that the graphic novel only covered the first half of the Keeper of the Lost Cities book until I received it. I was let down to learn this. Because of the book being split up, I also think the ending is a bit disappointing as it seems to end a little abruptly.I enjoyed the graphics and felt the illustrator did a good job bringing the magic of the lost cities to light. However, I did feel that Fitz was frumpy looking and did not seem to be as cute as he is made out to be. I am glad that I had read the series first so that I could have my own imaginings of how things look versus the graphic novel (I didn’t imagine the leapmaster to look like a giant disco ball).I was planning on introducing my children to the series with this graphic novel, however I think I will just wait a couple of years and have them read the regular novels instead.If you are a Keeper of the Lost Cities fan already, you will likely enjoy the book but it surely doesn’t add anything to the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Day 3 and there are only a few pages left for my 8yo daughter. I hope Part 2 comes out sooner than later. Anything to keep her reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A thrilling ride
reviews.reviewText: Sophie Foster, a 12-year-old girl, has always felt like she doesn't belong. She is extraordinary, able to read people's minds, and possesses exceptional intelligence. One day, while on a field trip, Sophie meets a boy named Fitz, who leads her to the realization that she is an elf. This discovery forces her to leave her former life behind and enter a new world. How will Sophie adjust to these significant changes in her life?What a thrilling graphic novel that will leave you in your seat. Although I have yet to read the first book, this adaptation (of the first part of book one) was enough to keep me engaged. The characters are so vibrant and full of powers that you can't help but get sucked into their world. The art style is breathtaking, and the plot is well-crafted, full of twists and turns that will keep you guessing until the end. I like the bonus pages on how to draw your favorite Keeper characters at the end.Sophie, the protagonist, is an intelligent and resourceful person who always puts others before herself. She is a true hero, and you can't help but root for her throughout the book. On the other hand, Fitz is a good character, but we don't see much of him until later in the story. Sophie's new friends are also impressive, and their dynamic adds another layer of excitement to the plot.I highly recommend this book to anyone who loves adventure and fantasy. It's a thrilling ride that you won't want to miss!Happy Reading, Paige ❤️ 📚Thank you to the publisher for sharing this excellent graphic novel with me, and I am leaving this review voluntarily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I enjoyed this very much!
reviews.reviewText: I got this from the library, I loved it so much I went to Barnes and Noble and bought a signed copy!I want to see more of Keefe! He looks so adorable ❤️‍🩹About this book: fast paced with plenty of pictures. Good for kotlc fans and kids who want to see pictures! It was a cute retelling about the book itself! Sophie’s illustrations look very nice and well drawn .If you have not bought it or get it fromThe library yet, do so.You won’t regret it…Happy reading!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We love the Sophie books and have devoured them all, with me and my husband reading them to my 9/10 year old as pre-bed family time. When I saw earlier in the year this was coming out, I preordered, and finally, on Friday it was delivered. My son has already finished it, absolutely loving it! We are waiting with bated breath for the final book of Keeper of the Lost Cities, so this was a wonderful thing to have in the meantime. He says it’s really good!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Novel even though its split midway- though
reviews.reviewText: loved the graphic novel. I was a bit skeptical because at first the images werent looking so good. But while reading it the graphics felt more and more natural and acurate. Although I dont like the design for Fitz.Overall worth buying even for a german reader like me. Plus the shipping was relativly fast for a product sent from the US.
